experiences.summary:
Inview is a web application designed for taking video interviews. It's mainly focused on a one shot principle where the candidate has only one chance to record their video answers.
As an admin you can create campaigns with a unique token which can be used to participate onthat certain campaign. Questions can be added to the campaign in the form of a plain, multiplechoice or video question.
Once the candidate opens the URL, they get routed to the welcome page with an introduction to the service and an optional video message. Then they are obliged to fill in a signup form to start the interview. When answering questions, the candidate is able to navigate to previous questions but he won't be able to have another go at the video questions.
Once finished, the participant will get routed to a finish page similar to the welcome page and the interview status is changed to 'finished'. After this the admin is able to have a look at the candidate's entry and mark it as favorite for easy access.

experiences.summary:
Agilitas is an HR services provider with a dual focus: the Division t interim focuses on the market for temporary employment, while Ascento offers its customers a broad range of HR consulting services.

What sets Agilitas apart from other players in the HR market is the socio-ethical approach, coupled with a market-based services.
experiences.task:
Situation: They have 3rd party implemented tools that allow job applicants to share their information straight into another used 3rd party backend. They would like to add an intermediary layer (the integration framework), hosted at agilitas, so that extra data and workflows can be added to the ongoing job applications. They would like to allow an internal jobs management application to get credit scoring for companies and to import their data.
Tasks given: * Development of the initial intermediary job application layer * API development (Agilitas integration framework)
* Add a workflow to send out emails to job applicants to correct and enrich their job application data, taking into account all GDPR regulations. * Add a 3rd party credit scoring api in the application layer to allow internal jobs management application to get and import credit scoring reports.
Actions: * Setup integration layer api to allow the top layer (3rd party custom web page) to get data from the underlying layer (3rd party data repository) * Setup api to allow the 3rd party top layer apply for new job * Every write to the underlying storage goes through a Queue mechanism (RabbitMQ) * Add support for updates from data repository to 3rd party mailing system to enable workflow by sending an request for update mail to job applicants with link to 3rd party custom web page * 3rd party web page requests data for updating job applicant data through our web api * Job Applicant submits data in the web page and update is routed through our web api, and goes into 3rd party repository * Add a web api to allow the jobs management application to interact with a 3rd party scoring web api
Result: * The 3rd party Job application web page can now get its data through our integration layer * Job applications are now routed through our integration layer * Job applicants are now requested to update and enrich their job application data through our integration layer, if GDPR permits that. * The internal jobs management application can now get credit scoring data from a 3rd party web api.

* There is no spoon, **out of the box** thinker (The best way is the one that fits the need best) * My goal is to help teams reach the synergetic/self-organized phase.

From importing estates through AWS SQS and AWS lambdas until they are visible on the website of Immoscoop.
Specifically I Added some tweaks to the authentication flow for a Soft-User concept (to be read as a non-email-authenticated user) so that a user could get easier access to specific features like saved searches which are not available to unknown users. To keep code in line, I regularly commented on PR's to get understanding and try to keep things as easy as possible.

**Project Focus**

The digital application for the Antwerp police force that quickly became the front-end application in Belgium. Focus holds backoffice applications and on-the-field applications to make the police officer on the street more versatile. Combining different external sources into 1 app can make the difference of capturing a criminal or finding a missing child.
experiences.task:
After a daily SCRUM meeting and some coffee, I start my day reviewing code from colleagues, adding value to existing repos by injecting fresh code, maintaining database architecture and API routes to ensure that the apps I work on function properly. Covid19 changed the world and subsequently also the way I work. Instead of maintaining physical contact with colleagues, I am now challenged to get out of the Slack or Microsoft-Teams keyboard bubble and enter the call bubble to tackle problems as soon as they occur.

Apps I work and have worked on are.

- ISLP: A React frontend build over the Legacy-app ISLP for adding different types of PV's.

- Filingcore: an imaging tool to link entities like persons, locations, groupings and vehicles to eachother to create a clear view. Created in such a way that the app could be reused for different services.

- Disappearances: a backoffice app for holding files about missing persons.

- Detention: a backoffice app for holding files about persons that are to be detained.

- Project Watcher: a framework to see changes of an entity over different internal and external sources.

- Police Search: the frontend app for the police officer to view all kinds of information about a searched person.

experiences.summary:
Inview is a web application designed for taking video interviews. It's mainly focused on a one shot principle where the candidate has only one chance to record their video answers.
As an admin you can create campaigns with a unique token which can be used to participate on that certain campaign. Questions can be added to the campaign in the form of a plain, multiple choice or video question.
Once the candidate opens the URL, they get routed to the welcome page with an introduction to the service and an optional video message. Then they are obliged to fill in a signup form to start the interview. When answering questions, the candidate is able to navigate to previous questions but won't be able to have another go at the video questions.
Once finished, the participant will get routed to a finish page similar to the welcome page and the interview status is changed to 'finished'. After this the admin is able to have a look at the candidate's entry and mark it as favorite for easy access.

Hi there! 👋
I'm Koen. I like to see myself as a developer first with a strong focus on UX principles. Here’s a breakdown of my skills as a hybrid between a developer and UX designer:
💻 Program the frontend: My primary skills are using frontend programming languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript to create layouts, interactive features or execute other design ideas.
👤 Plan and design web pages and apps: My secondary skills are using UX principles to create digital products. This includes using wireframes, prototypes and design tools to create blueprints for what a website or app will look like.
🤝 Collaborate with design and engineering teams: I thrive in collaborative environments, as a professional with both design and programming abilities, I act as the bridge between the two teams.

educations.summary: A Certified ScrumMaster® helps project teams properly use Scrum, increasing the likelihood of the project's overall success. CSMs understand Scrum values, practices, and applications and provide a level of knowledge and expertise above and beyond that of typical project managers. Kurt is a professional solution architect with more than 20 years of experience in software development, testing and Application Lifecycle Management. To me being receptive to other people’s ideas and suggestions is key to get better as a developer and a person.

Peter is a full stack software developer, architect and coach with a broad knowledge in both front-end and backend solutions. He designs, build and deploys non-trivial software using the right tools, doing whatever it takes to make the project a success. experiences.summary: During the last 3 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a clone of the Agilitas paymate web application. A full stack Javascript application with Database (MongoDB), API (NodeJS & Express), Authentication (OAuth2) and a nice UI (React, Material UI, React Hook Forms and React Query). And of course everything was covered by an agile scrum process with weekly sprints.

An 8 weeks bootcamp where modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Vue.js, Nodejs and TDD took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered REST and GraphQL API development in NodeJS with express and MongoDB.

Next, after some refresh of CSS and modern styling, we went deep in the application development with Vue.js & React. Through a test-driven approach, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by JavaScript experts/architects and expert guest speakers with specialization in sub domains such as automated testing, UI/UX, styled components, Docker/K8S, Angular, NestJS, ...

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read and discussed the book "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

During my education a small group of student colleagues and I developed a web application for the bachelor thesis of students at Thomas More Mechelen. I was selected as product owner and communicated with the customer to make sure their idea became reality. Thus BullSheets was born.
Bullsheet is a web application that digitalises the use of callsheets in the entertainment sector. It manages callsheets more efficiently and offers the possibility to edit callsheets or use other callsheets as a template to build on. It offers a built-in messaging service to quickly communicate if needed. If a delay occurs, the callsheet gets automatically edited with the click of a button. For more analysis, reports can be downloaded later (in excel).

B.ignited is a young and energetic business unit within the Cronos'​ Slingshot cluster. They develop, customize and integrate Test Automation Solutions.
For the duration of this internship I worked together with two student colleagues to add to the existing T3AS of B.ignited. We developed a service which translated various test result files into JSON-objects. The service built in Java Spring Boot translated files from xUnit, nUnit, jUnit, ... Further more we added a front end portal for the customers using Vue.js, where they could upload any accepted file format which then got added to a database and visualised on a separate page.
Working for a testing software company we wrote extensive unit tests with jUnit and End-to-End tests in Cypress.
experiences.task:
• Validate uploads • Translate files using StAX • Implement service in existing T3AS
• Testing with jUnit and Cypress

experiences.summary:
Strobbo specializes in creating HR-management tools to simplify personnel planning and automate payroll for companies of all sizes.

Strobbo development is organized into three autonomous teams, concurrently collaborating during each sprint. These teams consistently support one another in defining new features, addressing operational challenges, and shaping the product vision. During my tenure, I organically transitioned into a leadership position within one of these teams. Our responsibilities encompassed defining and delivering features, as well as enhancing overall processes. The subsequent projects and features reflect significant contributions during my time at Strobbo:
Planning sync with a third party Strobbo offers a planning tool designed to assist in employee scheduling. Given the growing difficulty in finding permanent employees, many companies resort to interim offices and short-term employments. To streamline this process, Strobbo integrates with several third-party entities through an employee sync feature. This functionality ensures that when you hire an employee through a third party, their details automatically appear in the Strobbo system.
While you can plan the schedule for these employees within Strobbo, the subsequent steps—such as payment and Dimona submissions (a method of informing the government about the employee's work on a given day)—require manual handling.
To address this, we've introduced the third-party planning sync, consisting of two key stages. The first involves introducing the concept of an external contract, and the second entails syncing this external contract information with the relevant third party.
Finally, I led coordination efforts with both third-party entities and pilot clients. Additionally, we developed operational tools to monitor and address potential issues. After completing these preparations, we successfully launched the feature and promptly communicated the updates to our clients.
Pragmatic security aproach Implemented a pragmatic security approach for a project, introducing SAST, DAST, and SCA tools. Developed an upgrade path to minimize vulnerabilities (90% less vulnerabilities) and conducted security training to enhance team awareness and responsiveness.
Improving payroll processing engine I spearheaded the enhancement of the payroll processing engine. This critical system operates based on a set of rules governing worktimes, such as weekend pay. I successfully implemented optimizations that significantly improved the speed and efficiency of payroll processing. Additionally, I introduced structural enhancements, incorporating best practices to elevate code maintainability. This strategic approach facilitated seamless updates and modifications to the system. Furthermore, I fortified the testing framework, implementing measures to ensure comprehensive testing. This initiative contributed to the development of a more robust and reliable payroll processing engine.
experiences.task: * Improving testability * Analyse/develop/deploy new features * Operational support * Improving overall security * Full stack development

experiences.summary:
Portima is a digital services company. They provide digital solutions and IT services to the community of insurance brokers, insurance companies and to the customers of the brokers. The insurance distribution market is expected to evolve strongly in the coming years, as competition from bank assurance and direct insurance companies increases. They also observe that the number of brokers is consolidating as a consequence of mergers and acquisitions. In order to make the new delivery model a reality, they need to make important investments and innovations in their products.
The project I worked on was called the repairer project. The main objective of this project was to get an existing application running in the **Cloud (Azure)**. There were 2 parts: * API with endpoints that would be used for an existing application called Brio * Internal application that is responsible for consuming the data that afterwards will be used for the Brio application.
To fulfill the task, we needed to **generate** an **API, internal application, DB, AAD**... My role in this project was mainly generating the frontend of the internal application in **React**. I also helped in the **Backend** where possible. The Backend was written in **.NET** in combination with a **SQL DB.

** I worked in an agile team with 2 other .NET developers. The 3 of us had ownership for completing this assignment. Important to note that prior to development we did the analysis ourself. Ranging from putting together a feasible architecture to finding out the specific needs of the user for the internal application and the API. With daily standups and a 3 weekly sprint planning we estimated our work and we kept an overview (Jira). One of the metrics we accomplished what I am proud of, is that we reached an overall testing coverage of 80% (integration & unit tests).

Immoscoop is a real estate platform with the added value of estate agents. In 2021, Immoscoop was relaunched with a completely new team, which immediately set to work to completely revamp the platform.
Immoscoop also wants to be a community. A community that includes all our professional users with whom we work closely.
Immoscoop decided also to create a new platform for estate agent called agent-portal. It's a tool that can be use to compare selling houses with the same features that was already sold in the past. This will help or bring the estate agent in a direction what the best price can be.

This tool was completely built from scratch and had Chiel the opportunity to explore with he's frontend skill to dive in the styling how it will look and what the best is for platform, to make it responsive as soon as possible so that is can run at least on desktop and tablet. Behind those 2 application to get it up and running perfectly there is a nice team behind of 2 front-enders, 3 full-stackers and 2 back-enders from Sri Lanka where we working as a team or even individual.

experiences.summary:
T-Shapes are metaphors used to describe the abilities of persons in the workforce. The vertical bar on the letter T represents the depth of related skills and expertise in a single field, whereas the horizontal bar is the ability to collaborate across disciplines with experts in other areas and to apply knowledge in areas of expertise other than one's own.
They can be used for current skills but they can also be used to describe a skillset that one wants to grow towards. T-Shapes are common in the world of agile software development. They showcase the diversity and need inside an agile team.
The T-shape generator is a **responsive web application** to generate your current and future T-shapes, look up T-shapes from your peers and export or link to other applications. And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints and 4 team members.
experiences.task: * Developing a fullstack JS application * Real-time generation of the T-shape drawings * Component-testing * Conducting the sprint reviews * Collaboration and intergration with the knowledgeDB scrum team (Angular/.NET)

experiences.summary:
Every year, Euricom hosts various events where new technologies can be discovered and experiences can be shared with different technologies. One of these events is our annual DevCruise to a sunny destination. In recent years we have launched an initiative to give positive feedback to a loudspeaker on those events by means of a nice card (a compliment).
Now, in the digital world, we are trying to emulate paper more and more. Instead of writing tickets, we could develop a solution that would allow us to send kudos using a mobile app or a progressive web app (PWA). The internship assignment therefore consists of making a short analysis and then describing it into a beautiful, functional app that is immediately used for a subsequent event.

**Rummikub** In the first year of my bachelor's degree in applied computer science, I made a Java project in a team of four in the second semester. The assignment was to make the well-known party game Rummikub online using Java and JavaFX. I learned a lot from this, not only about Java and JavaFX, but also about teamwork, which was quite difficult in the beginning. This is also because everything had to be online (covid) and there was no possibility to get to know my teammates better, which of course was a pity .
**
** **CSR-dashboard**
Fluvius needed a dashboard to present their Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Objectives and the associated Sustainable Development Goals (SDG's) to their customers. Also an application for the coordinator to adjust the information on the dashboard. Groups of 5 students worked with the Scrum method, 6 weeks Javascript for the dashboard and 6 weeks Java for the application.

**Webshop** In the third year, there was another client, Delaware. They required a webshop where customers could order their products, choose a shipment and place and track orders.  The project was in groups of 6 developers. The website was made in C# and .NET. Besides the website they also wanted a mobile app which contained the same webshop as the website. This mobile app was made in Kotlin using android studio.
